title: indesign and swatches
content:
don’t know if my problem is typographic enough for typophile, please forgive me if it isn’t.

I need adobe metallic-swatches for a document, but this library is not a default one in ind cs. i’ve tried to open eps files, ai files, libraries from other adobe programs, but nothing works. Anyone also had this problem, and maybe even solved it?

 [‹ FontLab Interpolation: Straight Lines -\> Curves](http://web.archive.org/web/20071109102623/http:/typophile.com/node/15998 "Go to previous forum topic") ["best" Spacing- and Kerning-Methods? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071109102623/http:/typophile.com/node/15849 "Go to next forum topic")
author: alexfjelldal

comments.content: As far as I know that one is not included with Indy. You could try Pantone’s site…
I found a workaround. i made an eps where the color i wanted is used, and then placed in th ind-doc.
